alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, southwestern Clay and north central Fayette Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pinch, or 8 miles east of Charleston, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Clendenin, Pinch, Coal Fork, Elkview, Glen, Bentree, Procious, Swiss, Indore and Pond Gap. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 5 and 21. Interstate 77 in West Virginia near mile marker 96. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 93 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas
